<Link id="l00001" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===- GenericLoopInfo - Generic Loop Info for graphs -----------&#42;- C++ -&#42;-===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00002" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00003" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Part of the LLVM Project, under the Apache License v2.0 with LLVM Exceptions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00004" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// See https://llvm.org/LICENSE.txt for license information.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00005" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0 WITH LLVM-exception</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00006" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00007" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This file defines the LoopInfoBase class that is used to identify natural</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// loops and determine the loop depth of various nodes in a generic graph of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// blocks.  A natural loop has exactly one entry-point, which is called the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// header. Note that natural loops may actually be several loops that share the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// same header node.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This analysis calculates the nesting structure of loops in a function.  For</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// each natural loop identified, this analysis identifies natural loops</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// contained entirely within the loop and the basic blocks that make up the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// loop.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// It can calculate on the fly various bits of information, for example:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  &#42; whether there is a preheader for the loop</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  &#42; the number of back edges to the header</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  &#42; whether or not a particular block branches out of the loop</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  &#42; the successor blocks of the loop</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  &#42; the loop depth</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  &#42; etc...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Note that this analysis specifically identifies &#42;Loops&#42; not cycles or SCCs</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// in the graph.  There can be strongly connected components in the graph which</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// this analysis will not recognize and that will not be represented by a Loop</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// instance.  In particular, a Loop might be inside such a non-loop SCC, or a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// non-loop SCC might contain a sub-SCC which is a Loop.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For an overview of terminology used in this API (and thus all of our loop</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// analyses or transforms), see docs/LoopTerminology.rst.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Return true if this loop is no longer valid.  The only valid use of this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// helper is &quot;assert(L.isInvalid())&quot; or equivalent, since IsInvalid is set to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// true by the destructor.  In other words, if this accessor returns true,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the caller has already triggered UB by calling this accessor; and so it</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// can only be called in a context where a return value of true indicates a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// programmer error.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopbase/#a7cea07afaa9cb9cb11334832b90eaf0a"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopbase/#a7cea07afaa9cb9cb11334832b90eaf0a">isInvalid</a>()</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="255"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// APIs for simple analysis of the loop.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="256"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="257"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Note that all of these methods can fail on general loops (ie, there may not</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="258"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// be a preheader, etc).  For best success, the loop simplification and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="259"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// induction variable canonicalization pass should be used to normalize loops</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="260"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// for easy analysis.  These methods assume canonical loops.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="261"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00307" /><CodeLine lineNumber="307"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Return all pairs of (&#95;inside&#95;block&#95;,&#95;outside&#95;block&#95;).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00308" /><CodeLine lineNumber="308"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopbase/#aad953b1e46f8bd2ca82b9cb7285a66a7">getExitEdges</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;Edge&gt;</a> &amp;ExitEdges) </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00309" /><CodeLine lineNumber="309"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00310" /><CodeLine lineNumber="310"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If there is a preheader for this loop, return it. A loop has a preheader</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00311" /><CodeLine lineNumber="311"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// if there is only one edge to the header of the loop from outside of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00312" /><CodeLine lineNumber="312"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// loop. If this is the case, the block branching to the header of the loop</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00314" /><CodeLine lineNumber="314"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00315" /><CodeLine lineNumber="315"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// This method returns null if there is no preheader for the loop.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00316" /><CodeLine lineNumber="316"><span class="doxyHighlight">  BlockT &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopbase/#ac3280e7f76f955403fe17eacf126b90d">getLoopPreheader</a>() </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="317"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00492" /><CodeLine lineNumber="492"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Since loop passes like SCEV are allowed to key analysis results off of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00493" /><CodeLine lineNumber="493"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &#96;Loop&#96; pointers, we cannot re-use pointers within a loop pass manager.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00494" /><CodeLine lineNumber="494"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This means loop passes should not be &#96;delete&#96; ing &#96;Loop&#96; objects directly</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00495" /><CodeLine lineNumber="495"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// (and risk a later &#96;Loop&#96; allocation re-using the address of a previous one)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00496" /><CodeLine lineNumber="496"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// but should be using LoopInfo::markAsRemoved, which keeps around the &#96;Loop&#96;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00497" /><CodeLine lineNumber="497"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// pointer till the end of the lifetime of the &#96;LoopInfo&#96; object.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00498" /><CodeLine lineNumber="498"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00499" /><CodeLine lineNumber="499"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// To make it easier to follow this rule, we mark the destructor as</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00594" /><CodeLine lineNumber="594"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Return all of the loops in the function in preorder across the loop</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00596" /><CodeLine lineNumber="596"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00597" /><CodeLine lineNumber="597"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Note that because loops form a forest of trees, preorder is equivalent to</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00629" /><CodeLine lineNumber="629"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00630" /><CodeLine lineNumber="630"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// This removes the specified top-level loop from this loop info object.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00631" /><CodeLine lineNumber="631"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The loop is not deleted, as it will presumably be inserted into</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00632" /><CodeLine lineNumber="632"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// another loop.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00633" /><CodeLine lineNumber="633" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopinfobase/#a7bfb10fc99484961d5fac51621793aa6"><span class="doxyHighlight">  LoopT &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopinfobase/#a7bfb10fc99484961d5fac51621793aa6">removeLoop</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopinfobase/#aea4b1950342e503aa8a2904f30ec7331">iterator</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>) &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00635" /><CodeLine lineNumber="635"><span class="doxyHighlight">    LoopT &#42;L = &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00636" /><CodeLine lineNumber="636"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(L-&gt;isOutermost() &amp;&amp; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Not a top-level loop!&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00637" /><CodeLine lineNumber="637"><span class="doxyHighlight">    TopLevelLoops.erase(TopLevelLoops.begin() + (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a> - <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopinfobase/#ab447b41b9c51151b5c6ef497a60689ae">begin</a>()));</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00643" /><CodeLine lineNumber="643"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// tree.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00699" /><CodeLine lineNumber="699"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00700" /><CodeLine lineNumber="700"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Destroy a loop that has been removed from the &#96;LoopInfo&#96; nest.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00701" /><CodeLine lineNumber="701"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00702" /><CodeLine lineNumber="702"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// This runs the destructor of the loop object making it invalid to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00703" /><CodeLine lineNumber="703"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// reference afterward. The memory is retained so that the &#42;pointer&#42; to the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00704" /><CodeLine lineNumber="704"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// loop remains valid.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00705" /><CodeLine lineNumber="705"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00706" /><CodeLine lineNumber="706"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The caller is responsible for removing this loop from the loop nest and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00707" /><CodeLine lineNumber="707"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// otherwise disconnecting it from the broader &#96;LoopInfo&#96; data structures.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00708" /><CodeLine lineNumber="708"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Callers that don&#39;t naturally handle this themselves should probably call</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00709" /><CodeLine lineNumber="709"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// &#96;erase&#39; instead.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00710" /><CodeLine lineNumber="710" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopinfobase/#ae98a33be737ade7a1f27130477b003f2"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopinfobase/#ae98a33be737ade7a1f27130477b003f2">destroy</a>(LoopT &#42;L) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00711" /><CodeLine lineNumber="711"><span class="doxyHighlight">    L-&gt;~LoopT();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00712" /><CodeLine lineNumber="712"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00713" /><CodeLine lineNumber="713"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Since LoopAllocator is a BumpPtrAllocator, this Deallocate only poisons</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00714" /><CodeLine lineNumber="714"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// \\c L, but the pointer remains valid for non-dereferencing uses.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00715" /><CodeLine lineNumber="715"><span class="doxyHighlight">    LoopAllocator.Deallocate(L);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00716" /><CodeLine lineNumber="716"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
